tutorial.title: Comedian Bot - Part 1
tutorial.descriptionContent: Ready for some chuckles? Let's set the stage for our very own Comedian Bot. In this first part, we'll program our bot to crack a joke, ensuring that our virtual comedian starts with a strong opening act.

executableContent.instructions:
Welcome to the **Comedian Bot** project. We'll be making a simple bot that's supposed to tell jokes.

Let's add the basic structure of an HTML document:
1. `<!doctype html>` defines the document type and version of HTML.
2.  Add `<html>`, `<head>`, and `<body>` tags.
3. Add a `<title>` inside the `<head>` and give the page a fancy title.
4. Also, link the CSS file using a `link` tag with `rel="stylesheet"` and `href="style.css"`.
5. Finally, ensure to link to the JavaScript file using `<script src="script.js"></script>` inside the `body`.

To start, let's add a header for our chat.

1. Add a `<div>` with the class `chat-header` inside the `<body>` tag.
2. Add a `<h2>` tag inside the div and set its content to `Comedian Bot`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
<!doctype html>
<html>
<head>
	<title>Comedian Bot</title>
	<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
</head>
<body>
	<script src="script.js"></script>
</body>
</html>
files.solvedContent: Comedian Bot

executableContent.instructions:
Underneath our header, we want to add an area for the chat content to populate.

1. Below the `chat-header` div, add a new div with the class `chat-content`. This is where our JavaScript code will output the bot's messages.

executableContent.instructions:
Now, let's move to the JavaScript part of our project.

1. Let's create an array called `joke`.
2. Add two strings to the array. `"What did 0 say to 8?"` and `"Nice belt."`. If you want to use a different joke, feel free to do so. Just make sure to add two strings.

executableContent.instructions:
We'll select the `chat-content` div, to append our bot's messages to it.

1. Declare a `chatContent` variable and select the `chat-content` div by using `document.querySelector(".chat-content")`.

files.name: index.html
files.content: Comedian Bot

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Next, we need to create a function to create a new div, where the bot will display its message.

1. Create a function named `appendBotMessage`, which takes `messageText` as a parameter.
2. Inside this function, create a new div with `const messageDiv = document.createElement("div")`.
3. Set the class name `message bot-message` and assign it to a variable `messageDiv` by coding ` messageDiv.className = "message bot-message"`.
4. Append the `messageDiv` to the `chatContent`.

files.name: index.html
files.content: Comedian Bot

files.name: script.js
files.content:
const joke = ["What did 0 say to 8?", "Nice belt."];
const chatContent = document.querySelector(".chat-content");

executableContent.instructions:
We need to create a new div to display the bot avatar inside the function. We'll use illustrations from Font Awesome. The. classes `fas` and `fa-robot` may look strange, but let's go with it now.

1. Inside the function `appendBotMessage`, create a new div with the class name `fas fa-robot message-avatar` and assign it to a variable `avatar`.
2. Append the newly created `div` (avatar) to the earlier created `messageDiv`.

files.name: index.html
files.content: Comedian Bot

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Next, we want to create a new div to display the text of the bot's message.

1. Inside the function `appendBotMessage`, create a new `div` with the class name `message-content` and assign it to a variable `contentDiv`.
2. Set the `textContent` of `contentDiv` to `messageText`.
3. After appending the avatar, append this newly created div to the `messageDiv`.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
So far, we've added a lot of empty `divs`. It will make sense in a minute. Let's call our `appendBotMessage` function when our page is loaded, with a welcome message from the bot.

1. After the function definition, call `appendBotMessage` function.
2. Pass a string as the parameter to display a welcome message such as `"Hello! I am Comedian Bot, here to make you laugh. Let me think of a joke."`

executableContent.instructions:
We're now displaying the welcome message of our bot, but we still need to show the image from *Font Awesome* â€” Font Awesome works by linking to their stylesheet and setting the correct classes.

1. In the HTML file, add another `link` in the `head` section with `<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/font-awesome/5.15.1/css/all.min.css">` to load the `fa-robot` icon.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Next up, we want the bot to tell us the joke. Let's add a delay before it `speaks` again to create a feeling of the bot thinking.

1. At the bottom of our JavaScript file, add a timeout by coding `setTimeout(function() { }, 1000);`
2. Inside the function that we pass the timeout, call `appendBotMessage()` and pass it another message like `"Ok, got one."`.

files.name: index.html
files.content: Comedian Bot

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Now, we'll let the bot tell the joke we've stored in our `joke` array using two more `setTimeout` functions.

1. Create two more `setTimeout` functions. The first one of the two additional timeouts should wait `1500` milliseconds and the other one `2000`.
2. In the first one, use ` appendBotMessage` to append the first element of the `joke` array.
3. In the second one, use ` appendBotMessage` to append the second element of the `joke` array.

executableContent.instructions:
We can't call our project done without CSS styling, right? Let's start with that.

1. In the CSS file, create a rule for both body and html.
2. In that rule, set the `font-family` to `sans-serif`.
3. Set the `margin` to `0` to maximize our viewing area.
4. Set the `height` to `100%`.

1. For the class `chat-header`, set `padding` to `10px` and `background-color` to `salmon`.

executableContent.instructions:
Next, let's style the chat content div.

1. Create a rule for the class `chat-content`.
2. Apply `margin: auto`, `overflow-y: auto`, and `padding: 12px 20px` to the `chat-content` class.
3. Add `display: flex` and `flex-direction: column` to make the incoming messages display from the top down.
4. Set the width to `80%` of the container width.

It's time to style the chat message.

1. Create a rule for the class `message`.
2. Apply a `margin` of `12px 0` to `.message` to put space between the consecutive messages.
3. Set `display: flex` and `align-items: flex-end` for `.message`.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's style the actual bot's message.

1. Style the content of bot messages by targeting elements with the class message-content inside elements with the class bot-message by coding `.bot-message .message-content { }`.
2. To the `bot-message .message-content`, set `max-width` to `70%`, `padding` to `12px 16px`, `background-color` to `whitesmoke`, and `border-radius` to `16px`.

Finally, the bot avatar needs some love.

1. Style the content of messages by targeting elements with the class message-avatar inside elements with the class message by coding `.message .message-avatar { }`.
2. Apply a `font-size` of `16px`, `margin-right` of `12px`, `color` of `whitesmoke`, `background-color` of `salmon`, `padding` of `10px 8px`, and `border-radius` of `50%` to the rule for both the`message` and the `message-avatar` classes.
